name: Microsoft Official Xbox One Adaptive Controller
description: The Microsoft Xbox One Adaptive Controller is a ground-breaking device specifically engineered for gamers with limited mobility. This controller features two large programmable buttons and 19 jacks to connect external inputs like switches, buttons, and joysticks. Each input can be mapped to various controller functions, allowing users to create a tailored setup that fits their unique needs. The device's lightweight and flat design make it easy to mount and use on different surfaces, offering flexibility and accessibility across a wide range of games and genres. Microsoft’s initiative has been praised for setting new standards in gaming inclusivity.
imageAlt: Microsoft Xbox One Adaptive Controller with customizable inputs
compatibility: Compatible with Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, and Windows 10/11 PCs. It also supports third-party assistive devices.

name: PlayStation 5 Access Controller
description: The PlayStation 5 Access Controller is designed by Sony to enhance the gaming experience for players with physical disabilities. This controller features a modular design, allowing users to customize button layouts and input configurations to match their specific needs. The controller supports various accessories and adaptive inputs, providing a versatile and inclusive gaming solution. Its ergonomic shape and responsive inputs ensure that even players with limited hand mobility can enjoy their favorite PlayStation 5 games without compromise. Sony’s dedication to accessibility with this device highlights its commitment to making gaming a universally enjoyable experience.
imageAlt: PlayStation 5 Access Controller with customizable layout
compatibility: Compatible with PlayStation 5 and can be integrated with various adaptive devices for customized gaming setups.

name: Logitech Adaptive Gaming Kit
description: The Logitech Adaptive Gaming Kit is an extensive collection of adaptive switches and buttons designed to work in tandem with the Xbox Adaptive Controller. This kit includes a variety of inputs such as large buttons, light touch buttons, and triggers, all of which can be arranged and connected to suit individual needs. The components are robust and highly responsive, providing reliable performance during gameplay. The kit's versatility makes it an ideal solution for gamers who require a personalized setup to accommodate different types of physical disabilities. With the Logitech Adaptive Gaming Kit, users can create an inclusive gaming environment that adapts to their specific requirements.
imageAlt: Logitech Adaptive Gaming Kit with various switches and buttons
compatibility: Designed to work with the Xbox Adaptive Controller and compatible with Xbox consoles and Windows 10/11 PCs.

name: QuadStick FPS Game Controller
description: The QuadStick FPS Game Controller is a highly specialized device designed for gamers with severe physical disabilities, including quadriplegia. It features a joystick operated by mouth and sip-and-puff inputs, which translate into precise gaming commands. This controller can emulate a mouse, keyboard, or gamepad, allowing for seamless integration with various gaming systems and PCs. The QuadStick’s advanced configuration options enable users to fine-tune their controls for competitive gaming, making it an invaluable tool for players who need alternative input methods. Its rugged design and responsive controls have made it a popular choice in the adaptive gaming community.
imageAlt: QuadStick FPS Game Controller with sip-and-puff technology
compatibility: Compatible with PCs, PlayStation, and Xbox consoles, and can be configured to work with various assistive technologies.

name: Tobii Eye Tracker 5
description: The Tobii Eye Tracker 5 is a cutting-edge device that allows users to control their computers and play games using their eye movements. It precisely tracks the user’s gaze and translates it into cursor movements and commands, providing a hands-free interface for gaming and other applications. This eye-tracking technology is particularly beneficial for individuals with limited or no use of their hands, offering them the ability to interact with digital content in a natural and intuitive way. The Tobii Eye Tracker 5 is known for its accuracy and responsiveness, making it a valuable tool for enhancing accessibility in gaming.
imageAlt: Tobii Eye Tracker 5 for hands-free gaming
compatibility: Works with Windows 10/11 PCs and is supported by a range of compatible games and applications. Can be integrated into existing systems to provide eye-tracking controls.

name: AbleNet BIGtrack 2
description: The AbleNet BIGtrack 2 is a large trackball designed for users with limited hand dexterity or motor control. Its oversized trackball makes it easy to move the cursor across the screen with minimal hand movement, and its two large buttons are perfect for users who have difficulty using standard mouse buttons. The BIGtrack 2’s sturdy base ensures stability during use, and it’s compatible with a variety of switches for even more customization. This device is ideal for both gaming and everyday computer use, providing an accessible solution for individuals who need an alternative to a traditional mouse.
imageAlt: AbleNet BIGtrack 2 trackball with large buttons
compatibility: Compatible with most computers and tablets that support a standard USB mouse. Can be connected to devices running Windows, macOS, and some Android systems.

name: HORI Tactical Assault Commander (TAC)
description: The HORI Tactical Assault Commander (TAC) Pro is a one-handed controller designed to provide a competitive edge in first-person shooter games. It features an ergonomic layout that places all essential controls within easy reach of one hand. The controller includes a keypad with mechanical keys and a highly responsive mouse, offering precise and rapid input. It’s especially beneficial for gamers who can use only one hand, providing them with the ability to enjoy fast-paced games effectively. The TAC Pro’s customizable key bindings and adjustable sensitivity settings allow for a personalized gaming experience tailored to individual preferences and needs.
imageAlt: HORI Tactical Assault Commander (TAC) Pro one-handed controller
compatibility: Compatible with PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, and Windows PCs. It supports various settings and profiles for different game genres.

name: Ben Heck’s Accessibility Controllers
description: Custom-built controllers, such as those designed by Ben Heck, are tailored specifically to the needs of individual gamers. These controllers can be configured with a wide variety of inputs and control options, including custom button layouts, specialized joysticks, and alternative input methods like sip-and-puff switches. Each controller is designed to address the unique physical requirements of its user, offering a level of personalization that standard gaming hardware cannot provide. These bespoke solutions are often created in collaboration with the user to ensure that the final product perfectly suits their needs and enhances their gaming experience.
imageAlt: Ben Heck’s Custom Accessibility Controller with various inputs
compatibility: Custom-built to user specifications, compatible with a wide range of gaming systems including PC, PlayStation, and Xbox platforms. Supports integration with various assistive technologies.
